data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is always facing forward. One cannot take 10 steps backwards, as these are not steps taken when facing forward. So, the answer is No.

You are turned around when you first start your journey. To turn around is to have completed all of the previous steps. So, the answer is yes.

The starting point would need to be somewhere around 6 steps farther away. To return to the starting point you need to take 10 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

You take one step before you return to the starting point. If you take 7 steps, you return just one step. So, the answer is Yes.

In the first step, you’re facing forward. If you take one step left, you have to take one step forward to get 1 step left. And with the second step – it’s facing the right way and it’s 4 minutes. In the third step – take 4 steps right. And in the fourth step – it’s taking 6 steps right. And with the fifth step – it’s facing the left way and it’s 12 minutes. So, the answer is Yes.
